job_details.Vacaturetitel: Jacobs Douwe Egberts - Intelligent Automation Engineer Intern
job_details.Functieomschrijving:
Join us as Intelligent Automation Engineer Intern at our international headquarters in Utrecht, starting in September 2024. In this internship, you will gain insider knowledge about how automation/robotic engineering influences JDE Peet's landscape and business structure, and you will also have the unique experience of coordinating with multiple important stakeholders within our international headquarters.

   Your key activities will be:
     * Monitor robots on daily basis
     * Collaborate with business leaders and obtain clear requirements
     * Draft Process Definition documents
     * Fix issues in robots (using UiPath codeing, AI and Machine learning, GenAI and Natural language processing)
     * Work with AMS team to develop and deploy automations

   Supported by a commendable 4.5 Glassdoor rating and 94% intern recommendation score, we pledge to provide you with a unique learning journey as part of our GIS IT Robotics team, where you'll gain valuable insights into the process of creating and maintaining robots/automations and how this plays an important role in global and international business structures.

   What's in it for you?
     * A monthly internship allowance of €525 (full-time)
     * Travel compensation if you don't have a free public transport card
     * Paid holidays for each internship term
     * Two weeks of remote working anywhere in Europe (EEA)
     * The chance to learn from the best Automation professionals out there!, * Commitment: You are ready to dedicate at least 6 months to this internship, preferably from the 2nd of September to February.
     * Availability: You can join the internship for 3 days per week, including three days in-office and one or two days remotely, ensuring an ideal balance between collaboration and independence.

   As we hope to have piqued your interest, please ensure you also meet the eligibility criteria and academic requirements:
     * Your internship should be included in your study curriculum and directly contribute to your academic results.
     * Your educational institution is willing to sign a collaboration agreement with JDE Peet's and when joining our Research departments, also sign an NDA agreement for internships.
     * You are either an EU(EEA) student residing in the Netherlands during the internship or a Non-EU(EEA) student enrolled and living in the Netherlands during the internship.
job_details.full_text:
Jacobs Douwe Egberts - Intelligent Automation Engineer Intern

Join us as Intelligent Automation Engineer Intern at our international headquarters in Utrecht, starting in September 2024. In this internship, you will gain insider knowledge about how automation/robotic engineering influences JDE Peet's landscape and business structure, and you will also have the unique experience of coordinating with multiple important stakeholders within our international headquarters.

   Your key activities will be:
     * Monitor robots on daily basis
     * Collaborate with business leaders and obtain clear requirements
     * Draft Process Definition documents
     * Fix issues in robots (using UiPath codeing, AI and Machine learning, GenAI and Natural language processing)
     * Work with AMS team to develop and deploy automations

   Supported by a commendable 4.5 Glassdoor rating and 94% intern recommendation score, we pledge to provide you with a unique learning journey as part of our GIS IT Robotics team, where you'll gain valuable insights into the process of creating and maintaining robots/automations and how this plays an important role in global and international business structures.

   What's in it for you?
     * A monthly internship allowance of €525 (full-time)
     * Travel compensation if you don't have a free public transport card
     * Paid holidays for each internship term
     * Two weeks of remote working anywhere in Europe (EEA)
     * The chance to learn from the best Automation professionals out there!, * Commitment: You are ready to dedicate at least 6 months to this internship, preferably from the 2nd of September to February.
     * Availability: You can join the internship for 3 days per week, including three days in-office and one or two days remotely, ensuring an ideal balance between collaboration and independence.

   As we hope to have piqued your interest, please ensure you also meet the eligibility criteria and academic requirements:
     * Your internship should be included in your study curriculum and directly contribute to your academic results.
     * Your educational institution is willing to sign a collaboration agreement with JDE Peet's and when joining our Research departments, also sign an NDA agreement for internships.
     * You are either an EU(EEA) student residing in the Netherlands during the internship or a Non-EU(EEA) student enrolled and living in the Netherlands during the internship.

profile_classification.rationale: The role focuses on monitoring and fixing existing automation robots using tools like UiPath, with mentions of AI/ML and GenAI for issue resolution. However, it lacks the core development, fine-tuning, or deployment of advanced AI models and systems characteristic of an ML or GenAI Engineer. The emphasis is more on operational maintenance and business process automation.

phrases.phrase: gain insider knowledge about how automation/robotic engineering influences JDE Peet's landscape and business structure
phrases.justification: This phrase indicates an understanding of how automation impacts the business's overall structure and operations.

phrases.phrase: collaborating with multiple important stakeholders within our international headquarters
phrases.justification: This highlights the need to interact with various business units and individuals to understand their needs and align automation efforts.

phrases.phrase: Collaborate with business leaders and obtain clear requirements
phrases.justification: Directly states the need to understand business needs and translate them into technical requirements for automation.

phrases.phrase: gain valuable insights into the process of creating and maintaining robots/automations and how this plays an important role in global and international business structures
phrases.justification: Emphasizes understanding the business impact and strategic role of automation within the company.

phrases.phrase: Fix issues in robots (using UiPath codeing, AI and Machine learning, GenAI and Natural language processing)
phrases.justification: Mentions using AI, ML, GenAI, and NLP in the context of fixing issues, implying some level of model interaction or understanding, though not core development.

phrases.phrase: Fix issues in robots (using UiPath codeing, AI and Machine learning, GenAI and Natural language processing)
phrases.justification: While focused on fixing, it involves working with code (UiPath) and potentially integrating AI/ML/GenAI components to resolve issues, which touches upon software development aspects.

phrases.phrase: Work with AMS team to develop and deploy automations
phrases.justification: Indicates involvement in the development and deployment of automation solutions, which is a form of software development in this context.

phrases.phrase: Monitor robots on daily basis
phrases.justification: This is a core operational task, involving the ongoing oversight and maintenance of deployed automation systems.

phrases.phrase: Fix issues in robots
phrases.justification: Troubleshooting and resolving problems in existing systems is a key aspect of operations and maintenance.

phrases.phrase: Work with AMS team to develop and deploy automations
phrases.justification: Deployment is a critical part of MLOps, and working with an AMS (likely Application Management Services or similar) team suggests involvement in production systems.

phrases.phrase: creating and maintaining robots/automations
phrases.justification: Directly refers to the ongoing maintenance and upkeep of automation systems, which falls under operations.
